generated_json.title: Chief Complaint
content: Recurrent cyst on wrist with recurrence after prior surgical removal, now requiring aspiration
generated_json.instruction: Please provide only the patient's chief complaint without any additional details or context. Avoid direct speech.

generated_json.title: History of Present Illness
content: The patient reports a recurrent cyst on the wrist that has reappeared after a prior surgical removal approximately 8 years ago. The cyst is associated with repetitive strain from activities such as push-ups and bench presses, which appear to exacerbate its formation. The patient notes that the cyst has recently become symptomatic, causing mild discomfort, prompting the current visit. The patient is seeking aspiration rather than surgical excision due to prior experience and preference. The patient also reports ongoing neurological symptoms in the lower leg following a prior surgery involving soft tissue neurolysis and interposition grafting, including persistent tingling and occasional electric shock-like sensations, particularly with movement or impact. The patient describes the sensations as tolerable but not painful, with no significant functional impairment. The patient is uncertain whether the symptoms are due to nerve regeneration or residual sensitivity. The patient expresses difficulty distinguishing between normal recovery and persistent pathology, noting ongoing swelling and altered sensation in the affected limb. The patient is currently undergoing rehabilitation and is considering further therapy for nerve desensitization. The patient is open to a trial of conservative management with observation and physical therapy before considering further intervention.

generated_json.title: Past Medical History
content: History of recurrent wrist cyst with prior surgical excision 8 years ago. History of surgical intervention for peripheral nerve injury involving soft tissue neurolysis and interposition grafting of the medial tibial nerve, with additional RPNI (reversed posterior nerve interposition) performed at the knee. No other significant past medical conditions reported.

sub-section.title: Assessment
content: Recurrent wrist ganglion cyst (ICD-10: D23.2)
Post-surgical nerve regeneration status, medial tibial nerve (ICD-10: Z51.89)
Residual nerve hypersensitivity, post-interposition graft (ICD-10: G57.8)
sub-section.instruction: Generate a list of the patient's current medical conditions, Only give all the current assessment and not historical information return it in a list. The result must be easily searchable in icd description so search for the icd code.

sub-section.title: Plan
content: Perform aspiration of recurrent wrist cyst under local anesthesia with mild sedation.
Schedule surgical excision of cyst if recurrence occurs after aspiration.
Refer to hand therapy for nerve desensitization and nerve glide exercises.
Initiate home-based nerve desensitization program with massage and graded sensory stimulation.
Monitor lower leg symptoms for progression; consider reoperation if persistent discomfort despite conservative management.
Continue observation for nerve regeneration in the medial tibial nerve, with expected timeline of 6–12 months for full recovery.
Educate patient on signs of recurrence or worsening symptoms requiring prompt evaluation.
sub-section.instruction: Detail the healthcare provider's plan of action to manage the patient's condition, specifying treatments, medications (include ongoing medications briefly), procedures, therapies, lifestyle modifications, referrals to specialists, patient education on condition and medications, and recommendations for counselings or support services. Dont provide any follow up details in this section, provide everything in a list.
